channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: President announces TrumpRx website for drugs, and pricing deal with Pfizer
item.description: The Trump administration says it is making deals with drug companies to lower prices U.S. consumers pay for medicines. But key details are missing on how the initiative would work.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration says it is making deals with drug companies to lower prices U.S. consumers pay for medicines. But key details are missing on how the initiative would work.

(Image credit: Francis Chung)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Trump administration uses taxpayer dollars to blame Democrats for government shutdown
item.description: Federal employees across the government reported seeing similar messages. Experts say the messages may violate ethics laws meant to keep partisan politics out of day-to-day governing.
item.content:encoded:
Federal employees across the government reported seeing similar messages. Experts say the messages may violate ethics laws meant to keep partisan politics out of day-to-day governing.

(Image credit: Screenshot)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: A lawsuit tries to block the Trump administration's efforts to merge personal data
item.description: A class action lawsuit argues that the administration's efforts to combine databases of personal information on Americans violate privacy laws and the Constitution.
item.content:encoded:
A class action lawsuit argues that the administration's efforts to combine databases of personal information on Americans violate privacy laws and the Constitution.

(Image credit: Pool)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Here's what a shutdown means for Smithsonian museums, memorials and the zoo
item.description: History tells us visitors will likely find shuttered doors at major cultural institutions. But they will also find plenty of alternatives.
item.content:encoded:
History tells us visitors will likely find shuttered doors at major cultural institutions. But they will also find plenty of alternatives.

(Image credit: Mark Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Pasta meals from Trader Joe's and Walmart may be linked to a deadly listeria outbreak
item.description: The USDA says the precooked pasta products, sold at Trader Joe's and Walmart, could be connected to a nationwide listeria outbreak that has killed four people and sickened at least 20 others.
item.content:encoded: The USDA says the precooked pasta products, sold at Trader Joe's and Walmart, could be connected to a nationwide listeria outbreak that has killed four people and sickened at least 20 others.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Spotify's Daniel Ek announces that he'll step aside as CEO
item.description: The founder of the world's biggest music streaming service says he'll remain at the company as Executive Chairman, and will be replaced by two co-CEOs.
item.content:encoded:
The founder of the world's biggest music streaming service says he'll remain at the company as Executive Chairman, and will be replaced by two co-CEOs.

(Image credit: Presley Ann)
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: With 'drug boat' strikes, Trump leans into war on terror tactic against cartels
item.description: The administration's approach to drug cartels relies — at least in part — on a blueprint for military strikes that mirror those waged during the global war on terrorism after the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks.
item.content:encoded:
The administration's approach to drug cartels relies — at least in part — on a blueprint for military strikes that mirror those waged during the global war on terrorism after the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Poll: Republicans get more of the blame than Democrats for a potential shutdown
item.description: As a government shutdown becomes more likely, a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll shows even though President Trump has a low approval rating, just 1 in 4 approve of how Democrats in Congress are doing.
item.content:encoded:
As a government shutdown becomes more likely, a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll shows even though President Trump has a low approval rating, just 1 in 4 approve of how Democrats in Congress are doing.

(Image credit: Rahul Mukherjee/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: 'Like ice melting': Journalists warn press freedom is in decline across Asia
item.description: China's jailing of citizen journalist Zhang Zhan highlights a deeper press freedom crisis across Asia.
item.content:encoded:
China's jailing of citizen journalist Zhang Zhan highlights a deeper press freedom crisis across Asia.

(Image credit: Ted Aljibe)
item.dc:creator: Ashish Valentine

item.title: Scientists create human eggs in the lab, using skin cells
item.description: Scientists created the eggs using DNA from adult skin cells, a step that could someday potentially lead to new ways to treat infertility and enable gay couples to have genetically related children.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists created the eggs using DNA from adult skin cells, a step that could someday potentially lead to new ways to treat infertility and enable gay couples to have genetically related children.

(Image credit: Mitalipov laboratory)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein
